.ceil().desc: Returns <var>x</var> rounded up to the nearest whole number.

.exp().desc: Returns the mathematical constant <var>e</var> to the power of <var>x</var>.

args.desc: Number to use.

.floor().desc: Returns <var>x</var> rounded down to the nearest whole number.

.pow().desc: Returns <var>a</var> raised to the power of <var>n</var>.

args.name: a
args.desc: The base.

args.name: n
args.desc: The exponent.

.random().desc: Returns a pseudo-random number between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive).

.round().desc: Returns <var>x</var> rounded to the nearest whole number.

Array().desc: Returns an empty array with a length of <var>n</var>.

args.name: n
args.desc: Length of the array.

.isArray().desc: Returns true if value is an array, false if it's not.

args.name: value
args.desc: Value to be checked.

#length.desc: Reflects the length of an array.

#concat().desc: Returns a new array comprised of the original array plus <var>element</var>(s).

args.name: element
args.desc: Element to add to the new array. If it's an array, its elements will be added instead.

#filter().desc: Returns a new array comprised of elements from the original array that pass a <var>test</var>.

args.name: test
args.desc: Function to filter the elements with. Return true to include the element, or false to skip it.

args.name: this
args.desc: Object to use as <var>this</var> when executing <var>test</var>.

#indexOf().desc: Returns the first index at which element can be found in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

args.name: element
args.desc: Element to locate in the array, compared using strict equality.

args.name: from
args.desc: Index at which to start searching. If negative, indicates an offset from the end of the array.

#join().desc: Returns an array's elements joined into a string separated by <var>separator</var>.

args.name: separator
args.desc: String to separate the elements with.

#lastIndexOf().desc: Returns the last index (searching backwards) at which element can be found in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

args.name: element
args.desc: Element to locate in the array, compared using strict equality.

args.name: from
args.desc: Index at which to start searching backwards. If negative, indicates an offset from the end of the array.

#pop().desc: Removes the last element from an array and returns it.

#push().desc: Adds <var>element</var>(s) the end of an array and returns the new length.

args.name: element
args.desc: Element to add to the end of the array.

#reverse().desc: Reverses an array and returns a reference to it.

#shift().desc: Removes the first element from an array and returns it.

#slice().desc: Returns a portion of an array.

args.name: begin
args.desc: Index at which to start extraction. If negative, indicates an offset from the end of the array.

args.name: end
args.desc: Index at which to end extraction. If negative, indicates an offset from the end of the array.

#sort().desc: Sorts an array and returns a reference to it.

args.name: compare
args.desc: Function to sort the elements by. Sorts <var>a</var> to a lower index than <var>b</var> if the return value is less than 0, higher if it's more than 0, and keeps them the same if it's exactly 0.

#splice().desc: Adds and/or removes <var>element</var>(s) from an array, and returns the removed <var>element</var>(s).

args.name: index
args.desc: Index at which to start changing the array. If negative, will begin that many elements from the end.

args.name: count
args.desc: Number of array element(s) to remove.

args.name: element
args.desc: Element to add to the array.

#unshift().desc: Adds <var>element</var>(s) to the beginning of an array and returns the new length.

args.name: element
args.desc: Element to add to the beginning of the array.

Function().desc: Returns a function containing the parsed <var>body</var>.

args.name: arg
args.desc: Named argument for the function.

args.name: body
args.desc: Code run in the function.

#length.desc: Number of arguments the function expects.

#apply().desc: Calls a function with a <var>context</var> and optional <var>args</var> and returns the output.

args.name: context
args.desc: Object to set <var>this</var> in the function to.

args.name: args
args.desc: Array of arguments to pass to the function.

#bind().desc: Returns a function that when called, calls the original function with the provided <var>context</var>, and optionally prepends <var>arg</var>ument(s).

args.name: context
args.desc: Object to set <var>this</var> in the function to.

args.name: arg
args.desc: Argument to pass to the function.

#call().desc: Calls a function with a <var>context</var> and optional <var>arg</var>uments and returns the output.

args.name: context
args.desc: Object to set <var>this</var> in the function to.

args.name: arg
args.desc: Argument to pass to the function.

args.name: value
args.desc: Value put in the string.

.fromCharCode().desc: Returns a string created using a sequence of Unicode values.

args.name: value
args.desc: A Unicode value.

#length.desc: Reflects the length of a string.

#charAt().desc: Returns the character at <var>index</var> in a string.

args.name: index
args.desc: Index of the character to get.

#charCodeAt().desc: Returns the Unicode value of a character at <var>index</var> in a string.

args.name: index
args.desc: Index of the character to get the Unicode value of.

#concat().desc: Returns a new string comprised of the original string plus <var>string</var>(s).

args.name: string
args.desc: String to append.

#indexOf().desc: Returns the first index at which text can be found in a string, or -1 if it is not present.

args.name: text
args.desc: Text to locate in the array.

args.name: from
args.desc: Index at which to start searching.

#lastIndexOf().desc: Returns the last index at which text can be found in a string, or -1 if it is not present.

args.name: text
args.desc: Text to locate in the array.

args.name: from
args.desc: Index at which to start searching backwards.

#split().desc: Splits a string into an array by a <var>separator</var>.

args.name: separator
args.desc: Separator to split the string with.

args.name: limit
args.desc: Maximum amount of times to split the string.

#toLocaleLowerCase().desc: Returns a string converted to lowercase, using any locale-specific case mappings.

#toLocaleUpperCase().desc: Returns a string converted to uppercase, using any locale-specific case mappings.

#toLowerCase().desc: Returns a string converted to lowercase.

#toUpperCase().desc: Returns a string converted to uppercase.

#trim().desc: Returns a string stripped of any leading and trailing whitespace.

#trimLeft().desc: Returns a string stripped of any leading whitespace.

#trimRight().desc: Returns a string stripped of any trailing whitespace.
